titles.title: Apostolic Epistles / Gǝbrä ḥawaryat "Acts of the Apostles"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mälʾǝktä Ṗeṭros qädamawi "First Epistle of Peter" [1 Peter] (fols. 6rv, 8r, 12r-13v, 17r-18v, 23rv), incomplete II) Mälʾǝktä Ṗeṭros dagǝmawi "Second Epistle of Peter" [2 Peter] (fols. 8rb-8vb, 11rv, 19ra-20vb, 24rv) III) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs qädamawi "First Epistle of John" [1 John] (fols. 9ra-10vb, 14ra-16vb, 21ra-22vb) IV) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs dagǝmawi "Second Epistle of John" [2 John] (fols. 22vb, 25ra-va) V) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs śalǝsawi "Third Epistle of John" [3 John] (fols. 25va-26va) VI) Mälʾǝktä Yaʿqob "Epistles of Jacob" [Jas.] (fols. 26va-33ra) VII) Mälʾǝktä Yǝhuda "Epistle of Judah" [Jude] (fols. 33ra-35ra) VIII) Gǝbrä ḥawaryat "Acts of the Apostles" [Acts] (fols. 35va-93vb)
Additiones 1-2.

donors.donor: Zǝkrä Maryam is mentioned in the concluding supplication (fol. 93vb).

dcomments.dcomment: Mid 18th cent. (?) Fols. 2 and 3-4 originate from two different older Mss. (late 15th or early 16th cent.?).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is very worn. Both boards have been re-used, probably originate from different codices. The leather cover (originally full, later quarter?) is to the most part missing. The Ms. has been resewn, the original sewing is missing. Fols. at the beginning of the codex are misplaced; some fols. are missing. Tear amended on fol. 79.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (probably re-used, originating from two different codices?) covered with reddish-brown tooled leather preserved only on the front board. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Crude blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather overback (2 tools were used: single line fillet and circle).

bnothers.bnother: Two rows of small holes are visible on the spinefolds of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
{I(8/fols. 1r-8v)} – II(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 8, stub before 1/fols. 9r-16v) – III(8; s.l.: 2, stub after 7; 7, stub after 2/fols. 17r-24v) – IV(10/fols. 25r-34v) – V(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 35r-44v) – VI(10/fols. 45r-54v) – VII(10/fols. 55r-64v) – VIII(10/fols. 65r-74v) – IX(10; s.l.: 2, stub after 8; 4, stub after 6; 7, stub after 3; 9, stub after 1/fols. 75r-84v) – X(10; s.l.: 2, stub after 8; 4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4; 9, stub after 1/fols. 85r-94v).
The structure of quire I cannot be identified at all; the structure of quires II and III cannot be identified not with certainty due to the poor condition of the Ms. In quire I, fols. 2-4 originate from two different older Mss.

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some fols. have an additional ruled line in the upper margin (fols. 38r-39r).

rulings.ruling:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Some fols. have an additional ruled line in the upper margin (fols. 38r-39r).

rubrications.rubrication: A few lines in the incipit page of Texts I and VIIII, headings of all other texts; the word kǝfl "section" and section numbers in Text VIII; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Throughout the Ms.: ቁ፡ for ቁም፡

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The correct order of fols. containing Texts I-IV is as follows: 1 Peter 1:1-17 (fol. 6rv); 1:17-2:7 (fol. 17rv); 2:7-20 (fol. 12rv); 2:20-3:9 (fol. 18rv); 3:9-22 (fol. 23rv); 4:1-14 (fol. 13rv); 5:11-14 (fol. 8ra-b) 2 Peter 1:1-9 (fol. 8rb-vb); 1:10-21 (fol. 24rv); 1:21-3:4 (fols. 19r-20v); 3:4-18 (fol. 11rv) 1 John 1:1-2:23 (fols. 9ra-10vb); 2:24-4:17 (fols. 14ra-16vb); 4:17-5:20 (fols. 21ra-22vb) 2 John 1:1-4 (fol. 22vb); 1:4-13 (fol. 25ra-va). -Text VIII is divided into 63 "sections" (kǝfl). -In a few fols. the word qum "stop", "stand" (fols. 15rb, 28ra 48ra), frequently in abbreviated form (ቁ፡) by a crude secondary hand, is written interlineally or in the margins throughout the Ms.

additional.cont: Fols. 2r-2v: Fragment of a lectionary (excerpt from the Epistle of Paul to the Hebrews, Heb. 3:7-4:3).
additional.det: Written on a leaf originating from an older manuscript (late 14th cent.?).

additional.cont: Fols. 3r-4v: Fragment of Revelation of John (Rev. 3:5-13).
additional.det: Written on leaves originating from an older manuscript (15th cent.?).

extras.extra: - The title is written on the front board with black modern paint. - The internal number of the monastic library (116) is written on fol. 1r. - Numbers, partly rubricated, are written by at least two different hands (?; cp. fols. 15r, 28r; and fol. 32r; one hand is the main, and another one is crude, more recent) in the margins throughout the Ms., indicating the division of the text. - The word ቁ (abbreviation for ቁም) is written by the recent, crude hand throughouot Texts I-VII. - Drawing of a small cross?, in ink: fols. 31r. - A few corrections written interlineally(sometimes by the main hand, sometimes by a secondary hand): e.g., fols. 6vb, 9ra, 11ra, 26ra, 33va, 97va. - The word zä-mutan is written by a secondary hand in the upper margin: fols. 15ra, 47rb. - Crude notes, writing exercises and drawings by recent hands, in ink, pen and pencil: e.g., fols. 1r-v, 5r-v, 72r, 90r, 93v.
